sen.j: 本項京都市伏見区の町名（きょうとし ふしみくのちょうめい）では、同区内に存在する公称町名を一覧化するとともに、その成立時期・成立過程等について概説する。
sen.e: This section on "Town Names in Fushimi Ward, Kyoto City", lists official "Town Names" in Fushimi Ward and summarizes the period and process of their establishment.

sen.cmt: 他の記事と表現を統一しました。

sen.j: 京都市の南部に位置する。
sen.e: Fushimi Ward is located in the southern part of Kyoto City.
Fushimi Ward is located in the southern part of Kyoto City.
Fushimi Ward is located in the southern part of Kyoto City.

sen.j: 区域は東西に長く、伏見城の城下町で酒造業で知られる伏見地区を中心に、北方の深草地区、東方の醍醐地区、西方・南方の郊外地区を含む。
sen.e: It stretches east and west, and includes Fushimi district, castle town of the Fushimi Castle well-known for its sake brewing industry in the center, Fukakusa district in the north, Daigo district in the east and suburban district in the west and the south.

It stretches east and west, and includes Fushimi district as its center, a castle town of the Fushimi-jo Castle well-known for its sake brewing industry, as well as Fukakusa district in the north, Daigo district in the east and suburban district in the west and the south.
sen.cmt: 一部表現を変更しました。
sen.e: It stretches east and west, and includes Fushimi district as its center, a castle town of the Fushimi-jo Castle well-known for its sake brewing industry, as well as Fukakusa district in the north, Daigo district in the east and suburban district in the west and the south.

sen.j: 区の東部は醍醐山を中心とする山地、西部は宇治川、桂川に沿った平地である。
sen.e: The eastern part of the Ward is mountain terrain with Mt. Daigo in the center and the western part is plain area along Uji-gawa River and Katsura-gawa River.
The eastern part of the ward is mountain terrain with Mt. Daigo in the center and the western part is flatland along the Uji-gawa River and the Katsura-gawa River.
sen.cmt: 一部表現を変更しました。
sen.e: The eastern part of the ward is mountain terrain with Mt. Daigo in the center and the western part is flatland along the Uji-gawa River and the Katsura-gawa River.

sen.j: 区の南部には宇治市、久御山町にまたがって旧巨椋池（おぐらいけ）干拓地が広がる。
sen.e: In the southern part of the Ward, stretches Ogura-ike Reclaimed Land extending over Uji City and Kumiyama-cho Town.
sen.cmt: 参考文献「山科区」の「check」欄に倣い、「--町」は、「--cho Town」で統一いたします。

sen.e: In the southern part of the ward stretches Ogura-ike Reclaimed Land extending over Uji City and the town of Kumiyama-cho.

sen.j: 区境は東端の山間部で滋賀県大津市とわずかに接する。
sen.e: The ward slightly shares a border with Otsu City, Shiga Prefecture at its east end in the Sankanbu (mountain-ringed region).
The ward slightly shares a border with Otsu City, Shiga Prefecture in the mountains at its east end.
sen.cmt: Sankanbu を削除し、山間部→in the mountains としました。

sen.j: 北は京都市山科区、東山区、南区 (京都市)、西は向日市、長岡京市、大山崎町、南は宇治市、久御山町、八幡市に接する。
sen.e: Yamashina Ward, Higashiyama Ward and Minami Ward, Kyoto City (Kyoto City) are located in the north, Muko City, Nagaokakyo City and Oyamazaki-cho Town in the west and Uji City, Kumiyama-cho Town and Yawata City in the south.

It is bordered with Yamashina Ward, Higashiyama Ward and Minami Ward (Kyoto City) in the north, Muko City, Nagaokakyo City and Oyamazaki-cho in the west and Uji City, Kumiyama-cho and Yawata City in the south.

sen.j: 面積61.62平方キロメートル。
sen.e: It covers an area of 61.62 square kilometers.

sen.j: 2009年3月現在の推計人口は約283,000人。
sen.e: Its population projection is about 283,000 as of March 2009.

sen.j: 区域はかつての紀伊郡、宇治郡を中心に西部には乙訓郡、久世郡、綴喜郡の一部を含む。
sen.e: It includes the former Kii-gun and Uji-gun counties in the center and the former Otokuni-gun, Kuse-gun counties and a part of Tsuzuki-gun County in the west.
It includes the former Kii and Uji counties in the center and a part of the former Otokuni, Kuse and Tsuzuki counties in the west.
It includes the former Kii and Uji counties in the center and a part of the former Otokuni, Kuse and Tsuzuki counties in the west.

sen.j: 区内には伏見稲荷大社、醍醐寺、伏見城跡、明治天皇伏見桃山陵、京都競馬場などがある。
sen.e: There are Fushimi-Inari Taisha Shrine, Daigo-ji Temple, the ruins of Fushimi-jo Castle, the Imperial mausoleum of Emperor Meiji, Fushimi-no-Momoyama-no-Misasagi, Kyoto Race Course and so on in the ward.

There are Fushimi-Inari Taisha Shrine, Daigo-ji Temple, the ruins of Fushimi-jo Castle, Fushimi-no-Momoyama-no-Misasagi which is the Imperial mausoleum of Emperor Meiji, Kyoto Race Course and so on in the ward.
sen.cmt: 明治天皇伏見桃山陵→Fushimi-no-Momoyama-no-Misasagi which is the Imperial mausoleum of Emperor Meiji としました。
sen.e: There are Fushimi-Inari Taisha Shrine, Daigo-ji Temple, the ruins of Fushimi-jo Castle, Fushimi-no-Momoyama-no-Misasagi which is the Imperial mausoleum of Emperor Meiji, Kyoto Race Course and so on in the ward.

sen.j: 区の成立は昭和6年（1931年）である。
sen.e: The ward was established in 1931.
The ward was established in 1931.
The ward was established in 1931.

sen.j: 同年京都市は周辺の多くの町村を編入し、市域を拡大したが、うち伏見市、紀伊郡深草町、堀内村、竹田村、下鳥羽村、横大路村、向島村（むかいじまむら）、納所村（のうそむら）、宇治郡醍醐村の区域をもって伏見区が成立した。
sen.e: In the same year, Kyoto City expanded its area by integrating many towns and villages into it and Fushimi Ward was established integrating Fushimi City, Fukakusa-cho Town, Kii-gun County, Horiuchi-mura, Takeda-mura, Shimotoba-mura, Yokooji-mura, Mukaijima-mura, Nouso-mura villages and Daigo-mura Village, Uji-gun County.
sen.cmt: 参考文献「山科区」の「check」欄に倣い、「--郡」は、「--gun County」で、「--村」は、「--mura Village」で、統一いたします。
sen.e: In the same year, Kyoto City expanded its area by integrating many towns and villages into it and Fushimi Ward was established integrating Fushimi City, Fukakusa town, Horiuchi village, Takeda village, Shimotoba village, Yokooji village, Mukaijima village, Noso village in Kii County and Daigo village, Uji County.
sen.cmt: 歴史的な変遷の中での説明のため、○○町→XX town, ○○村→○○ village としています。
sen.e: In the same year, Kyoto City expanded its area by integrating many towns and villages into it and Fushimi Ward was established integrating Fushimi City, Fukakusa town, Horiuchi village, Takeda village, Shimotoba village, Yokooji village, Mukaijima village, Noso village in Kii County and Daigo village, Uji County.

sen.j: その後、昭和25年（1950年）に乙訓郡久我村（こがむら）及び羽束師村（はつかしむら）、昭和32年（1957年）に久世郡淀町を編入している。
sen.e: Afterward, Fushimi Ward integrated into it Koga-mura and Hazukashi-mura villages, Otokuni-gun County in 1950 and Yodo-cho Town, Kuse-gun County in 1957.
Afterward, Fushimi Ward integrated into it Koga and Hatsukashi villages, Otokuni County in 1950 and Yodo town, Kuse County in 1957.
sen.cmt: 歴史的な変遷の中での説明のため、○○町→XX town, ○○村→○○ village としています。

tit.cmt: 小タイトルのため、一部を小文字に変更しました。

sen.j: 京都市内の町名には「大原来迎院町」のように旧村名、旧大字名に由来する地名（上記例の場合は「大原」）を冠称するものと、「亀屋町」「菊屋町」のような単独町名とがある。
sen.e: The Town Names of Kyoto City are categorized into those using their former village names or former Oaza (large section of village) such as 'Ohara Raikoin-Cho' (in this case, 'Ohara' is former name) and those using an independent name of a town such as 'Kameya-Cho' and 'Kikuya-Cho'.

The town names of Kyoto City are categorized into those using their former village names or former Oaza (large section of village) such as 'Ohara Raikoin-cho' (in this case, 'Ohara' is the former name) and those using an independent name of a town such as 'Kameya-cho' and 'Kikuya-cho.'
sen.cmt: 「○○町」→○○-cho と小文字にしました。
sen.e: The town names of Kyoto City are categorized into those using their former village names or former Oaza (large section of village) such as 'Ohara Raikoin-cho' (in this case, 'Ohara' is the former name) and those using an independent name of a town such as 'Kameya-cho' and 'Kikuya-cho.'

sen.j: 伏見区においては中心部の旧伏見市の区域は単独町名、その他は原則として旧大字名などの地区名を冠した複合町名である。
sen.e: The former Fushimi City district in the center of Fushimi Ward uses an independent name of a town and the others use, in principle, a complex name including the name of the former Oaza and so on.

The former Fushimi City district in the center of Fushimi Ward uses independent town names while the rest of the city uses, in principle, complex names including those prefixed by former names of Oaza (large section of village) and so on.
sen.cmt: 大字 補足を追加しました。
sen.e: The former Fushimi City district in the center of Fushimi Ward uses independent town names while the rest of the city uses, in principle, complex names including those prefixed by former names of Oaza (large section of village) and so on.

sen.j: 区内の公称町名の数は、『角川日本地名大辞典 26 京都府』下巻によれば1980年現在630町であった（「丁目」を有するものも1町とカウントする）。
sen.e: According to the second volume of "Kadokawa Nihon Chimei Daijiten No. 26 Kyoto-Fu" (Kadokawa dictionary of place-names of Japan, No.26 Kyoto Prefecture), there were officially 630 declared towns in 1980 (A town called with 'chome' is counted as a town).

According to the second volume of "Kadokawa Nihon Chimei Daijiten No. 26 Kyoto-Fu" (Kadokawa dictionary of place-names of Japan, No.26 Kyoto Prefecture), there were officially 630 declared towns as of 1980. (A town called with 'chome' is counted as a town.).

According to the second volume of "Kadokawa Nihon Chimei Daijiten No. 26 Kyoto-Fu" (Kadokawa dictionary of place-names of Japan, No.26 Kyoto Prefecture), there were officially 630 declared towns as of 1980. (A town called with 'chome' is counted as a town.).

sen.j: これらの町は2009年現在も大部分が存続しているが、1997年（平成9年）と2006年（平成18年）に土地区画整理事業実施に伴う町名町界の整理があり、町数は差引で12町増えて642町となっている。
sen.e: While most of these towns still exist in 2009, the names and the borders of some towns were changed in accordance with the land readjustment project in 1997 and 2006 and the number of towns became 642 with 12 towns having been increased.

sen.j: 伏見区の中心部は、豊臣秀吉が築いた伏見城の城下町であり、近世から町地化されていた。
sen.e: The central part of Fushimi Ward was the castle town of Fushimi Castle constructed by Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI and urbanized since the early-modern times.
The central part of Fushimi Ward was the castle town of Fushimi-jo Castle constructed by Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI and has been urbanized since the early-modern times.
sen.cmt: 伏見城→Fushimi-jo Castle としました。
sen.e: The central part of Fushimi Ward was the castle town of Fushimi-jo Castle constructed by Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI and has been urbanized since the early-modern times.

sen.j: 享保3年（1718年）の『伏見大概記』によれば、当時の伏見は北組9組、南組9組の町組が組織され、計263の町名が記されている。
sen.e: Fushimi Taigaiki (The General Record of Fushimi) of 1718 describes that such Machigumi (town society) as nine Kitagumi (the north unit) and nine Minamigumi (the south unit) were organized in Fushimi and there were 263 town names.

"Fushimi Taigaiki" (The General Record of Fushimi) of 1718 states that there were town societies called Machigumi at the time in Fushimi, in which nine Kitagumi (the north unit) and nine Minamigumi (the south unit) were organized, and it describes 263 town names.
sen.cmt: 表現を一部修正しました。
sen.e: "Fushimi Taigaiki" (The General Record of Fushimi) of 1718 states that there were town societies called Machigumi at the time in Fushimi, in which nine Kitagumi (the north unit) and nine Minamigumi (the south unit) were organized, and it describes 263 town names.

sen.j: これら263町の中には、複数の町組に重複して属するものもあり、実際の町数はこれより若干少ない。
sen.e: Some of these 263 towns belonged to more than one Machigumi and so the real number of towns were a little smaller than 263.
Some of these 263 towns belonged to more than one Machigumi and so the real number of towns were a little smaller than 263.
Some of these 263 towns belonged to more than one Machigumi and so the real number of towns were a little smaller than 263.

sen.j: また、江戸時代末期から明治時代初頭にかけて、1町が「東・西」「上・下」に分割されたり、町組に属していなかった周辺部の町が編入されるなどして町数に変動があり、明治時代初期には267町が存在した。
sen.e: From the end of Edo period to the early Meiji period, some towns were divided into 'east and west' or 'upper and lower' and some neighboring towns not belonging to any Machigumi were integrated into Fushimi, and there existed 267 towns in the early Meiji period.

From the end of Edo period to the early Meiji period, some towns were divided into 'east and west' or 'upper and lower' and some neighboring towns not belonging to any Machigumi were integrated into Fushimi, and there existed 267 towns in the early Meiji period.

sen.j: これらの町のうち、明治10年（1877年）に48町、及び明治22年（1889年）に31町が周辺の村に編入され、残余は188町となった。
sen.e: Out of these towns, 48 were integrated into some surrounding Mura (villages) in 1877 and 31 in 1889 and 188 towns remained.
Out of these towns, 48 were integrated into some surrounding villages in 1877 and 31 in 1889 and 188 towns remained.
Out of these towns, 48 were integrated into some surrounding villages in 1877 and 31 in 1889 and 188 towns remained.

sen.j: 明治10年に当時の六地蔵村に編入された15町のうち9町は、現在の行政区画では宇治市に属している。
sen.e: Fifteen towns were integrated into Rokujizo-mura Village at that time in 1877, out of which nine towns belong to Uji City in the current administrative division.
Of the 15 towns integrated into the then Rokujizo village in 1877, 9 towns belong to Uji City in the current administrative division.
sen.cmt: 表現を一部修正しました。
sen.e: Of the 15 towns integrated into the then Rokujizo village in 1877, 9 towns belong to Uji City in the current administrative division.

sen.j: 昭和4年（1929年）の伏見市成立時には、「東・西」「上・下」に分割されていた町を再統合したり、小規模な町を隣町に編入する等の整理が行われ、町数は20減って168町となった。
sen.e: At the time of establishment of Fushimi City in 1929, some towns divided into 'east and west' or 'upper and lower' were reintegrated and some small towns were integrated into neighboring towns, and the number of towns was decreases by 20 and became 168.

At the time of establishment of Fushimi City in 1929, some towns that had been divided into 'east and west' or 'upper and lower' were reintegrated and some small towns were incorporated into neighboring towns, resulting in the number of 168 towns with the decrease of 20.
sen.cmt: 表現を一部修正しました。
sen.e: At the time of establishment of Fushimi City in 1929, some towns that had been divided into 'east and west' or 'upper and lower' were reintegrated and some small towns were incorporated into neighboring towns, resulting in the number of 168 towns with the decrease of 20.

sen.j: なお、以上の町数は、「銀座町一、二、三、四丁目」などの各「丁目」を1町とカウントしている。
sen.e: However, the above numbers of towns were based on counting as a town 'Chome' like 'Ginza-cho 1-chome, 2-chome, 3-chome, 4-chome' and so on.
However, the above numbers of towns were based on counting each 'chome' as one town such as '1-chome, 2-chome, 3-chome, 4-chome Ginza-cho' and so on.
sen.cmt: 表現を一部修正しました。
sen.e: However, the above numbers of towns were based on counting each 'chome' as one town such as '1-chome, 2-chome, 3-chome, 4-chome Ginza-cho' and so on.

tit.cmt: 小タイトルのため、一部を小文字に変更しました。

sen.j: 明治元年（1868年）、京都府設置に際し、伏見地区は1番組〜17番組に編成された。
sen.e: At the time of establishment of Kyoto Prefecture in 1868, Fushimi district was organized as Ichibangumi-Junanabangumi (the First unit-the 17th unit).
At the time of establishment of Kyoto Prefecture in 1868, Fushimi district was organized into bangumi (town unit) Nos. 1 to 17.
sen.cmt: 番組→bangumi として他の記事と統一しました。
sen.e: At the time of establishment of Kyoto Prefecture in 1868, Fushimi district was organized into bangumi (town unit) Nos. 1 to 17.

sen.j: 明治5年（1872年）にはこれが16区に再編され、「伏見第○区」と称するようになった。
sen.e: In 1872, it was reorganized into 16-Ku (sections) and each section came to be called 'Fushimi Dai--Ku (--st, nd, rd or th Section).'
In 1872, it was reorganized into 16 wards and each ward came to be called 'Fushimi Ward No. X.'
sen.cmt: ここでの題○区→ward としました。
sen.e: In 1872, it was reorganized into 16 wards and each ward came to be called 'Fushimi Ward No. X.'

sen.j: 明治7年（1874年）、浜側町が呉服町に編入、風呂屋町が紙子屋町と下板橋町に編入されて消滅し、この時点での町数は267町であった。
sen.e: In 1874, Hamagawa-cho Town was integrated into Gofuku-machi Town, and Furoyamachi Town disappeared to be integrated into Kamikoya-cho and Shimoitabashi-cho towns, and the number of towns at that time was 267.
sen.cmt: 「浜側町」は読み方不明ですが、「Hamagawa-cho」としました。
sen.e: In 1874, Hamagawa town was integrated into Gofuku town, and Furoya town disappeared to be integrated into Kamikoya town and Shimoitabashi town, resulting in number of towns at that time of 267.
sen.cmt: 歴史的な変遷の上での説明のため、○○町→○○town としています。
sen.e: In 1874, Hamagawa town was integrated into Gofuku town, and Furoya town disappeared to be integrated into Kamikoya town and Shimoitabashi town, resulting in number of towns at that time of 267.

sen.j: 同年、これら267町を第1区〜第4区に編成。
sen.e: In the same year, these 267 towns were reorganized into Daiikku-Daiyonku (the First Section-the Forth Section).
In the same year, these 267 towns were reorganized into wards Nos. 1 to 4.
sen.cmt: 第1区〜第4区→wards Nos. 1 to 4 としました。
sen.e: In the same year, these 267 towns were reorganized into wards Nos. 1 to 4.

sen.j: 明治10年（1877年）には計48町を周辺の堀内村（8町）、深草村（5町）、大亀谷村（16町）、六地蔵村（15町）、景勝村（4町）へ編入し、町数は219となる。
sen.e: In 1877, 48 towns in total were integrated into the surrounding villages (mura), i.e., Horiuchi-mura (8 towns), Fukakusa-mura (5), Okameya-mura (16), Rokujizo-mura (15) and Kagekatsu mura (4) and the number of towns became 219.

In 1877, 48 towns in total were integrated into the surrounding villages, i.e., Horiuchi village (8 towns), Fukakusa village (5), Okamedani village (16), Rokujizo village (15) and Kagekatsu village (4), resulting in the number of towns of 219.
sen.cmt: ○○村→○○village としました。大亀谷→Okamedani としました。
sen.e: In 1877, 48 towns in total were integrated into the surrounding villages, i.e., Horiuchi village (8 towns), Fukakusa village (5), Okamedani village (16), Rokujizo village (15) and Kagekatsu village (4), resulting in the number of towns of 219.

sen.j: 郡区町村編制法公布に伴い、明治12年（1879年）伏見区が設置され、上記の4区のうち第3・4区が各2分割されて6組が設置され、「伏水第○組」と称するようになった。
sen.e: Upon promulgation of Gun-ku-cho-son Henseiho (Act for the alignment of local government system), Fushimi Ward was established in 1879, the Third and Fourth sections of the above four sections were divided into two respectively resulting in establishment of six Kumi (unit) and each unit came to be called 'Fushimi Dai--Kumi (--st, nd, rd or th Unit).'

Upon promulgation of Gun-ku-cho-son Henseiho (Act for the alignment of local government system), Fushimi Ward was established in 1879, and the wards Nos. 3 and 4 of the above four wards were divided into two respectively, resulting in the establishment of six kumi (unit), with each unit being called 'Fushimi kumi No. X.'
sen.cmt: 伏水第○組→Fushimi kumi No. X としました（他の記事と統一しました）。
sen.e: Upon promulgation of Gun-ku-cho-son Henseiho (Act for the alignment of local government system), Fushimi Ward was established in 1879, and the wards Nos. 3 and 4 of the above four wards were divided into two respectively, resulting in the establishment of six kumi (unit), with each unit being called 'Fushimi kumi No. X.'

sen.j: 明治14年（1881年）1月、伏見区は廃止され、伏水第1組〜第6組は紀伊郡第5組〜第10組となる。
sen.e: In January, 1881, Fushimi Ward was abolished and Fushimi First Unit-Sixth Unit became Kii-gun County Fifth Unit-Tenth Unit.
In January, 1881, Fushimi Ward was abolished and Fushimi kumi Nos. 1 to 6 became Kii County kumi Nos. 5 to 10.
sen.cmt: 伏水第1組〜第6組→Fushimi kumi Nos. 1 to 6 紀伊郡第5組〜第10組→Kii County kumi Nos. 5 to 10 としました。
sen.e: In January, 1881, Fushimi Ward was abolished and Fushimi kumi Nos. 1 to 6 became Kii County kumi Nos. 5 to 10.

sen.j: これら6組は同年10月、6連合となり、「山村町外34ヵ町連合」等の名称が付された。
sen.e: These six units became six Rengo (federations) in October in the same year and were given names including 'Federation of Yamamura-cho and the 34 other towns.'
These six kumi became six rengo (federations) in October in the same year and were given names including 'Rengo of Yamamura town and other 34 towns.'
sen.cmt: 山村町外34ヵ町連合→Rengo of Yamamura town and other 34 towns としました。
sen.e: These six kumi became six rengo (federations) in October in the same year and were given names including 'Rengo of Yamamura town and other 34 towns.'

sen.j: 明治17年（1884年）には上述の「山村町外34ヵ町連合」が「直違橋三丁目外34ヵ町連合」に改称されるなど、連合の名称が変更されている。
sen.e: In 1884, the names of Rengo (federations) were changed as the above 'Federation of Yamamura-cho and the 34 other towns' was renamed 'Federation of Sujikai-bashi 3 Chome and the 34 other towns.'
In 1884, the names of rengo were changed such as the above 'Rengo of Yamamura town and other 34 towns' being renamed to 'Rengo of Sujikaibashi 3-chome and other 34 towns.'
sen.cmt: 直違橋三丁目外34ヵ町連合→Rengo of Sujikaibashi 3-chome and other 34 towns としました。
sen.e: In 1884, the names of rengo were changed such as the above 'Rengo of Yamamura town and other 34 towns' being renamed to 'Rengo of Sujikaibashi 3-chome and other 34 towns.'

sen.j: 明治22年（1889年）、市制町村制施行に伴い紀伊郡伏見町が成立した。
sen.e: In accordance with the enforcement of the Municipal Government Act in 1889, Fushimi-machi, Kii-gun County was established.
In accordance with the enforcement of the Municipal Government Act in 1889, Fushimi town, Kii County was established.
sen.cmt: 歴史的な変遷の中での説明のため、紀伊郡伏見町→Fushimi town, Kii County としました。
sen.e: In accordance with the enforcement of the Municipal Government Act in 1889, Fushimi town, Kii County was established.

sen.j: この時、28町を深草村、3町を向島村へ編入し、残余の188町は伏見町の大字となった。
sen.e: At that time, 28 towns were integrated into Fukakusa-mura Village and three towns into Mukaijima-mura village and the remaining 188 towns became Oaza of Fushimi-machi Town.
At that time, 28 towns were integrated into Fukakusa village and three towns into Mukaijima village and the remaining 188 towns became Oaza of Fushimi town.
sen.cmt: 歴史的な変遷の中での説明のため、○○町→XX town, ○○村→○○ village としています。
sen.e: At that time, 28 towns were integrated into Fukakusa village and three towns into Mukaijima village and the remaining 188 towns became Oaza of Fushimi town.

sen.j: 同時に景勝村が編入されて大字景勝となり、伏見町は計189の大字で構成されることとなった。
sen.e: At the same time, Kagekatsu-mura village was integrated into the town and became Oaza Kagekatsu, and Fushimi-machi Town came to consist of 189 Oaza in total.
At the same time, Kagekatsu village was integrated into the town and became Oaza Kagekatsu, and Fushimi town came to consist of 189 Oaza in total.
sen.cmt: 歴史的な変遷の中での説明のため、○○町→XX town, ○○村→○○ village としています。
sen.e: At the same time, Kagekatsu village was integrated into the town and became Oaza Kagekatsu, and Fushimi town came to consist of 189 Oaza in total.

sen.j: 昭和4年（1929年）には市制を施行し伏見市となるが、この時、前述のように20町が整理されて、旧伏見地区の町数は168となった。
sen.e: It became a municipality as Fushimi City in 1929, when the number of towns in the former Fushimi district became 168 with 20 towns having been decreased as above-mentioned.
It became a municipality as Fushimi City in 1929, and the number of towns in the former Fushimi district became 168 with 20 towns having been decreased as above-mentioned.
sen.cmt: 一部翻訳を修正しました。
sen.e: It became a municipality as Fushimi City in 1929, and the number of towns in the former Fushimi district became 168 with 20 towns having been decreased as above-mentioned.

sen.j: 同時に大字景勝が8町に分割されたため、伏見市の町数は計176となった。
sen.e: At the same time, Oaza Kagekatsu was divided into eight towns, which made the number of towns in Fushimi City 176 in total.
At the same time, Oaza Kagekatsu was divided into eight towns, which made the number of towns in Fushimi City 176 in total.
At the same time, Oaza Kagekatsu was divided into eight towns, which made the number of towns in Fushimi City 176 in total.
